setObservations

public void setObservations(double[][] observations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Set the observations for the PDFs. Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).

Specified by:
setObservations in interface MultiInfoCalculator
Parameters:
observations -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

startIndividualObservations

public void startIndividualObservations()
User elects to set observations one by one rather than in one go. Will need to call endIndividualObservations before calling any of the compute functions, otherwise the previous observations will be used.

Specified by:
startIndividualObservations in interface MultiInfoCalculator

computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states)
Compute the local MI values for these given values, using the previously provided observations to compute the probabilities. Calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.

Specified by:
computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface MultiInfoCalculator

computeLocalJointEntropyUsingPreviousObservations

public double[] computeLocalJointEntropyUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states)
Compute the local joint entropy values for these given values, using the previously provided observations to compute the probabilities. Calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.
